extendedIngredients.name: carom seeds
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ tsp ajwain or carom seeds

extendedIngredients.name: chili powder
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ or ½ tsp organic red chili powder (1/2 tsp red chili powder made the tikka a bit hot)
metaInformation: (1/2 tsp chili powder made the tikka a bit )

extendedIngredients.name: dried coriander leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: few chopped coriander leaves for garnishing

extendedIngredients.name: ginger-garlic paste
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ tbsp ginger-garlic paste or crushed ginger-garlic (approx ½ inch ginger + 3-4 garlic crushed in a mortar & pestle)
metaInformation: (approx ½ inch ginger + 3-4 garlic in a mortar & pestle)

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: few drops of lemon juice as required and lemon wedges to be served

extendedIngredients.name: oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tbsp oil (to be used only if grilling or baking the mushrooms in the oven)
metaInformation: (to be used only if grilling or baking the mushrooms in the oven)

extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium sized onion, sliced thinly with some salt & lemon juice added - served as an accompaniment.
metaInformation: with some salt & lemon juice added - served as an accompaniment.

extendedIngredients.name: rock salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: salt + black salt as required or rock salt

recipes.title: mushroom tikka , how to make mushroom tikka | easy

winePairing.pairingText: Asian on the menu? Try pairing with Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and Chenin Blanc. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 10 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling
productMatches.description: The Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling is a dry, crisp, refreshing style of Riesling with beautiful fruit flavors, crisp acidity and an elegant finish. It offers inviting floral and mandarin aromas with a clean finish. This is an incredibly versatile food wine and my favorite with oysters.

recipes.instructions: rinse the mushrooms well in water.drain and wipe them dry.trim the earthy base stalks a little.in a mixing bowl, take all the mushrooms.add all the spice powders, carom seeds, salt and oil.mix well.keep aside to marinate for 20-25 minutes.preheat the oven to 200 degrees C.after 20-25 mins, add the gram flour and mix well.bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes or till the mushrooms are cooked and tender and are browned.after 15-20 minutes when grilling, you can turn the skewers so that there is uniform grilling.if you want you can sprinkle or spray some oil on the mushrooms after 15-20 minutes.sprinkle some lemon juice, chaat masala, coriander leaves on the mushroom tikka.serve mushroom tikka hot or warm with a green chutney, rotis or naan or even bread.

steps.step: rinse the mushrooms well in water.drain and wipe them dry.trim the earthy base stalks a little.in a mixing bowl, take all the mushrooms.add all the spice powders, carom seeds, salt and oil.mix well.keep aside to marinate for 20-25 minutes.preheat the oven to 200 degrees C.after 20-25 mins, add the gram flour and mix well.bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes or till the mushrooms are cooked and tender and are browned.after 15-20 minutes when grilling, you can turn the skewers so that there is uniform grilling.if you want you can sprinkle or spray some oil on the mushrooms after 15-20 minutes.sprinkle some lemon juice, chaat masala, coriander leaves on the mushroom tikka.serve mushroom tikka hot or warm with a green chutney, rotis or naan or even bread.
